title: Atom structure - neutrons in Zn-70 Se-74 and Ge-76

content.question: Three atomic nuclei are described by the notation <math alttext="Z n with mass number 70 and atomic number 30" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mmultiscripts><mtext>Zn</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>30</mn><mn>70</mn></mmultiscripts></math>, <math alttext="S e with mass number 74 and atomic number 34" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mmultiscripts><mtext>Se</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>34</mn><mn>74</mn></mmultiscripts></math>, and <math alttext="G e with mass number 76 and atomic number 32" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mmultiscripts><mtext>Ge</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>32</mn><mn>76</mn></mmultiscripts></math>. Which of the following correctly ranks the number <math alttext="N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>N</mi></math> of neutrons in the three nuclei?

choices.label: <math alttext="N sub S e is greater than, N sub G e, which is greater than N sub Z n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>Se</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>Ge</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>Zn</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="N sub S e equals, N sub G e, which is greater than N sub Z n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>Se</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>Ge</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>Zn</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="N sub G e is greater than, N sub S e, which is greater than N sub Z n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>Ge</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>Se</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>Zn</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="N sub G e is greater than, N sub S e, which equals N sub Z n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>Ge</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>Se</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>Zn</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="N sub G e is greater than, N sub S e, which equals N sub Z n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>Ge</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>Se</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>N</mi><mtext>Zn</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 15.2: The Bohr Model of Atomic Structure

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
